verses.verse: "Where <S%H575><s%> has your beloved <S%H1730><s%> gone, <S%H1980><s%> O most beautiful <S%H3303><s%> among women <S%H802><s%>? Where <S%H575><s%> has your beloved <S%H1730><s%> turned, <S%H6437><s%> That we may seek <S%H1245><s%> him with you?"

"My beloved <S%H1730><s%> has gone <S%H3381><s%> down <S%H3381><s%> to his garden, <S%H1588><s%> To the beds <S%H6170><s%> of balsam, <S%H1314><s%> To pasture <S%H7462><s%> [his flock] in the gardens <S%H1588><s%> And gather <S%H3950><s%> lilies. <S%H7799><s%>
"I am my beloved <S%H1730><s%>'s and my beloved is mine, He who pastures <S%H7462><s%> [his flock] among the lilies. <S%H7799><s%>"

"You are as beautiful <S%H3303><s%> as Tirzah, <S%H8656><s%> my darling, <S%H7474><s%> As lovely <S%H5000><s%> as Jerusalem, <S%H3389><s%> As awesome <S%H366><s%> as an army <S%H1713><s%> with banners. <S%H1713><s%>

"Turn <S%H5437><s%> your eyes <S%H5869><s%> away <S%H5437><s%> from me, For they have confused <S%H7292><s%> me; Your hair <S%H8181><s%> is like a flock <S%H5739><s%> of goats <S%H5795><s%> That have descended <S%H1570><s%> from Gilead. <S%H1568><s%>

"Your teeth <S%H8127><s%> are like a flock <S%H5739><s%> of ewes <S%H7353><s%> Which <S%H7945><s%> have come <S%H5927><s%> up from [their] washing, <S%H7367><s%> All <S%H3605><s%> of which <S%H7945><s%> bear <S%H8382><s%> twins, <S%H8382><s%> And not one <S%H369><s%> among them has lost <S%H9599><s%> her young. <S%H9599><s%>
"Your temples <S%H7541><s%> are like a slice <S%H6400><s%> of a pomegranate <S%H7416><s%> Behind <S%H4480><s%> <S%H1157><s%> your veil. <S%H6777><s%>
"There <S%H1992><s%> are sixty <S%H8346><s%> queens <S%H4436><s%> and eighty <S%H8084><s%> concubines, <S%H6370><s%> And maidens <S%H5959><s%> without <S%H369><s%> number; <S%H4557><s%>

[But] my dove, <S%H3123><s%> my perfect <S%H8535><s%> one, <S%H8535><s%> is unique: <S%H259><s%> She is her mother's only <S%H259><s%> [daughter;] She is the pure <S%H1249><s%> [child] of the one who bore <S%H3205><s%> her. The maidens <S%H1323><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> her and called <S%H833><s%> her blessed, <S%H833><s%> The queens <S%H4436><s%> and the concubines <S%H6370><s%> [also,] and they praised <S%H1984><s%> her, [saying,]

'Who <S%H4310><s%> is this <S%H384><s%> that grows <S%H8259><s%> like <S%H3644><s%> the dawn, <S%H7837><s%> As beautiful <S%H3303><s%> as the full <S%H3842><s%> moon, <S%H3842><s%> As pure <S%H1249><s%> as the sun, <S%H2535><s%> As awesome <S%H366><s%> as an army <S%H1713><s%> with banners <S%H1713><s%>?'

"I went <S%H3381><s%> down <S%H3381><s%> to the orchard <S%H1593><s%> of nut <S%H93><s%> trees <S%H93><s%> To see <S%H7200><s%> the blossoms of the valley, <S%H3><s%> To see <S%H5158><s%> whether the vine <S%H7200><s%> had budded <S%H1612><s%> [Or] the pomegranates <S%H6524><s%> had bloomed. <S%H7416><s%>
"Before I was aware, <S%H3045><s%> my soul <S%H5315><s%> set <S%H7760><s%> me [Over] the chariots <S%H4818><s%> of my noble <S%H5081><s%> people. <S%H5971><s%>"

"Come <S%H7725><s%> back, <S%H7725><s%> come <S%H7725><s%> back, <S%H7725><s%> O Shulammite; <S%H7759><s%> Come <S%H7725><s%> back, <S%H7725><s%> come <S%H7725><s%> back, <S%H7725><s%> that we may gaze <S%H2372><s%> at you!" "Why <S%H4100><s%> should you gaze <S%H2372><s%> at the Shulammite, <S%H7759><s%> As at the dance <S%H4246><s%> of the two companies <S%H4264><s%>?
